repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: Most other functions in this CPython API files come with the Python documentation (e.g. the C++ API does not come with docs). They tend to get easily out of sync with the official CPython documentation and can get quite long. However if you prefer to have the documentation added I can copy them over from the Cpython docs.

comment_data.body: Is it a problem for Cython to have a variable name here similar to a type? Other definitions in this file already use it as variable name as well.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,18 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # UTF-8 encoded bytes.  The size is determined with strlen().
     unicode PyUnicode_FromString(const char *u)
 
+    unicode PyUnicode_New(Py_ssize_t size, Py_UCS4 maxchar)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromKindAndData(int kind, const void *buffer, Py_ssize_t size)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromFormat(const char *format, ...)
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GetLength(object unicode) except -1

comment_data.body: `from` is a keyword so can't be an argument name.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +130,18 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # UTF-8 encoded bytes.  The size is determined with strlen().
     unicode PyUnicode_FromString(const char *u)
 
+    unicode PyUnicode_New(Py_ssize_t size, Py_UCS4 maxchar)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromKindAndData(int kind, const void *buffer, Py_ssize_t size)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromFormat(const char *format, ...)
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GetLength(object unicode) except -1
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_CopyCharacters(object to, Py_ssize_t to_start, object from, Py_ssize_t from_start, Py_ssize_t how_many) except -1

comment_data.body: I don't think this is an issue
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,18 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # UTF-8 encoded bytes.  The size is determined with strlen().
     unicode PyUnicode_FromString(const char *u)
 
+    unicode PyUnicode_New(Py_ssize_t size, Py_UCS4 maxchar)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromKindAndData(int kind, const void *buffer, Py_ssize_t size)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromFormat(const char *format, ...)
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GetLength(object unicode) except -1

comment_data.body: The parser needs to be rather smart regarding types since Cython allows you to leave out either the type (because of Python) or the argument name (because of C). Therefore it can handle this case just fine.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,18 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # UTF-8 encoded bytes.  The size is determined with strlen().
     unicode PyUnicode_FromString(const char *u)
 
+    unicode PyUnicode_New(Py_ssize_t size, Py_UCS4 maxchar)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromKindAndData(int kind, const void *buffer, Py_ssize_t size)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromFormat(const char *format, ...)
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GetLength(object unicode) except -1

comment_data.body: We try to use the documented argument names to help with keyword argument calls, but if we can't, we either chose similar names (which I tend to prefer) or an underscore as suffix. We use `pfrom` and `pto` for the pointers in `memcpy()` and friends, for example, although that wouldn't fit here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +130,18 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # UTF-8 encoded bytes.  The size is determined with strlen().
     unicode PyUnicode_FromString(const char *u)
 
+    unicode PyUnicode_New(Py_ssize_t size, Py_UCS4 maxchar)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromKindAndData(int kind, const void *buffer, Py_ssize_t size)
+    unicode PyUnicode_FromFormat(const char *format, ...)
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GetLength(object unicode) except -1
+    Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_CopyCharacters(object to, Py_ssize_t to_start, object from, Py_ssize_t from_start, Py_ssize_t how_many) except -1

comment_data.body: This is part of the 3.10 deprecation cycle and removed in 3.12. Even if we don't copy the whole documentation, I think that's still worth mentioning.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,6 +23,21 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # New in version 3.3.
     Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GET_LENGTH(object o)
 
+    Py_UCS1 *PyUnicode_1BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS2 *PyUnicode_2BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS4 *PyUnicode_4BYTE_DATA(object o)
+
+    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND

comment_data.body: This is part of the 3.10 deprecation cycle and removed in 3.12. Even if we don't copy the whole documentation, I think that's still worth mentioning.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,6 +23,21 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # New in version 3.3.
     Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GET_LENGTH(object o)
 
+    Py_UCS1 *PyUnicode_1BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS2 *PyUnicode_2BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS4 *PyUnicode_4BYTE_DATA(object o)
+
+    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND

comment_data.body:
Let's make it clear that the comment only belongs to one line, not the whole block.
```suggestion
    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND  # Deprecated since version 3.10, will be removed in version 3.12.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,6 +28,22 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # New in version 3.3.
     Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GET_LENGTH(object o)
 
+    Py_UCS1 *PyUnicode_1BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS2 *PyUnicode_2BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS4 *PyUnicode_4BYTE_DATA(object o)
+
+    # Deprecated since version 3.10, will be removed in version 3.12.
+    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND

comment_data.body: I don't remember – is `<stdint.h>` safe to include in a platform independent way these days?

Hm apparently this is a c99/c++89 feature and only available in msvc since the 2010 version. It appears we already use it in https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/Cython/Includes/cpython/time.pxd which might need to be fixed as well. I replaced it with
```
ctypedef unsigned char  uint8_t
ctypedef unsigned short uint16_t
```
for now.

Let's not require us to change this line later just because the release of Python 3.12 goes as planned.
```suggestion
    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND  # Deprecated since Python 3.10, removed in 3.12.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,6 +29,21 @@ cdef extern from *:
     # New in version 3.3.
     Py_ssize_t PyUnicode_GET_LENGTH(object o)
 
+    Py_UCS1 *PyUnicode_1BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS2 *PyUnicode_2BYTE_DATA(object o)
+    Py_UCS4 *PyUnicode_4BYTE_DATA(object o)
+
+    int PyUnicode_WCHAR_KIND  # Deprecated since version 3.10, will be removed in version 3.12.

comment_data.body:
I think we can avoid defining unrelated names here.
```suggestion
    ctypedef unsigned char Py_UCS1  # uint8_t
    ctypedef unsigned short Py_UCS2  # uint16_t
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,10 @@
+
 cdef extern from *:
+    ctypedef unsigned char  uint8_t
+    ctypedef unsigned short uint16_t
+    ctypedef uint8_t Py_UCS1
+    ctypedef uint16_t Py_UCS2

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: add missing unicode APIs
